item.title: Enumerate vRO Workflow Inputs into a JSON object
item.description: Just this week I had to create a JSON object that contained all of the workflow input parameters and their respective values. While I can’t guarantee this is the best way to do it, it definitely works. I’ve tried to keep the comments succinct so if you have any questions please ask. Code // Get all input parameters for the parent workflow var inParamsArray = workflow.rootWorkflow.inParameters; // Get all input parameters for the current workflow to search through later var paramFinder = workflow.

item.title: Execute HP-OO v10 flows from vRealize Orchestrator
item.description: Have you used the HTTP REST plugin in vRealize Orchestrator (vRO) before? It’s a fantastic plugin that really pushes the envelope on what you can integrate with vRO. Here’s a quick rundown of how you configure your REST operations: Configure a REST endpoint. Define a REST operation against the specified endpoint. Create a workflow from the new REST operation to use in your workflows. These steps are easy to do, but following this method only support a handful of authentication methods and you can’t define additional HTTP headers in your REST operations when you create them.
